ygData.subject: Re: Hrmmm..
ygData.msgSnippet: Actually Gather shadows works too but that is a self only and is your own fault. I don t think it is clever since you can just walk up on some one and do it.
ygData.messageBody:
Actually Gather shadows works too but that is a self only and is your own
fault. I don't think it is clever since you can just walk up on some one
and do it. One SOB on Fen Ro does it a lot any time he sees some one with a
pet he Invisi's them, he of course waits till they are in a fight. He is
also the type of guy who casts see Invisible on guards so they will kill
and dark characters using the spell.

<-- Enigma -->
http://members.door.net/enigma



-----Original Message-----
From: Warthog [SMTP:warthog@...]
Sent: Thursday, April 22, 1999 7:20 AM
To: EQCheats@onelist.com
Subject: [EQCheats] Re: Hrmmm..

From: Warthog <warthog@...>

> Someone could "bind affinity" to you where you would get killed after
getting killed.

Bah that is no exploit. In order for someone to bind you, two conditions
must be met. First and foremost, they have to be in your party. Being in
your party means you trust them (or that you are a frickin idiot to join
their party without knowing them) and give consent. The second condition
is that a spellcaster can only bind people in city areas (Highhold Pass
is considered a city however).

> If you have a pet and someone makes you invisible, the pet goes away.

This works on all classes cept Necromancers, which you have to use
Invisible to Undead on. Most consider it an exploit, I think it's just
damn clever.
